Name: The Empathy Quotient - 40 Item Version

Paper Reference: Baron-Cohen, S., & Wheelwright, S. (2004). The Empathy Quotient: An Investigation of Adults with Asperger Syndrome or High Functioning Autism, and Normal Sex Differences. Journal of Autism and Developmental Disorders, 34(2), 163-175.

Name: Positive Outcomes of Cannabis Use Scale
Measures: Percieved Positive Effects of Cannabis Use
Subscales: Social Enhancement, Mood Enhancement, Cognitige Enhancement, Sexual Enhancement
Paper Reference: Parnes, J. E., Prince, M. A., & Conner, B. T. (2024). Development and Validation of the Positive Outcomes of Cannabis Use Scale (POCUS) Among Predominantly White Adults in the United States. Assessment, 32(1).

Name: Coping Behaviours Inventory
Subscales: Positive Thinking, Negative Thinking, Avoidance/Distraction, Seeking Social Support
Paper Reference: Litman, G. K., Stapleton, J., Oppenheim, A. N., & Peleg, B. M. (1983). An Instrument for Measuring Coping Behaviours in Hospitalized Alcoholics: Implications for Relapse Prevention Treatment. British Journal of Addiction, 78(3), 269-276.

Name: The Internet Addiction Test
Subscales: Productivity at work, school, or home; Social behaviours; Emotional connection to and response from using the internet; General patterns of internet use
Paper Reference: Young, K. S. (1998). Internet Addiction Test (IAT) [Database record]. APA PsycTests.

Name: Irrational Beliefs Inventory
Subscales: Worrying, Rigidity, Need for Approval, Problem Avoidance, Emotional Irresponsibility
Paper Reference: Koopmans, P. C., Sanderman, R., Timmerman, I., & Emmelkamp, P. M. G. (1994). Irrational Beliefs Inventory (IBI, IBI-50) [Database record]? APA PsycTests.

Name: Narcissistic Personality Inventory
Subscales: Authority, Exhibitionism, Superiority, Vanity, Exploitativeness, Entitlement, Self-Sufficiency
Paper Reference: Raskin, R., & Hall, C. S. (1979). A narcissistic Personality inventory. Psychological Reports, 45(2), 590.

Name: General Self-Efficacy Scale
Paper Reference: Schwarzer, R., & Jerusalem, M. (1995). General Self-Efficacy Scale (GSE) [Database record]. APA PsycTests.

Name: Academic Self-Efficacy Scale
Subscales: Learning process, Reading, Comprehension, Memory, Curricular activities, Time management, Teacher-student relationship, Peer relationship, Utilization of resources, Goal orientation, Adjustment, Examination
Paper Reference: Gafoor, K. A., & Ashraf, M. (2007). Academic Self-Efficacy Scale. University of Calicut, Department of Education.

Name: Positive Generalisation Scale
Measures: Tendency to Generalise Positivity from Experience to Self-Concept
Subscales: Lateral generalisation, Upward generalisation, Social generalisation
Paper Reference: Eisner, L. R., Johnson, S. L., & Carver, C. S. (2008).  Cognitive responses to failure and success relate uniquely to bipolar depression versus mania. Journal of Abnormal Psychology, 117(1), 154-163.

Name: Self-Regulation Questionnaire
Subscales: Recieving, Evaluating, Triggering, Searching, Planning, Implementing, Assessing
Paper Reference: Brown, J. M., Miller, W. R., & Lawendowski, L. A. (1999). The self-regulation questionnaire. In L. VandeCreek & T. L. Jackson (Eds.), Innovations onClinicalpractice: A source book, Vol. 17, pp. 281-292. Professional Resource Press/Professional Resource Exchange.

Name: Appearance Anxiety Inventory
Subscales: Threat Monitoring, Camouflaging, Avoidance
Paper Reference: Veale, D., Eshkevaria, E., Kanakama, N., Ellisona, N., Costa, A., & Werner, T. (2014). The Appearance Anxiety Inventory: Validation of a Process Measure in the Treatment of Body Dysmorphic Disorder. Behavioural and Cognitive Psychotherapy, 42, 605-616.

Name: Repetitive Behaviours Questionnaire
Measures: Restricted and Repetitive Behaviours (especially in Autistic individuals)
Subscales: Insistence on Sameness (IS), Repetitive Sensory-Motor Behaviours (RSMB)
Paper Reference: Jones, C. R. G., Livingston, L. A., Fretwell, C., Uljarevi?, M., Carrington, S. J., Shah, P., & Leekam, S. R. (2024). Measuring self and informant perspectives of restricted and repetitive (RRBs): Psychometric evaluation of the Repetitive Behaviours Questionnaire-3 (RBQ-3) in adult Clinical practice and research settings. Molecular Autism, 15(1), Article 24.

Name: Brief Experiential Avoidance Questionnaire
Paper Reference: Gamez, W., Chmielewski, M., Kotov, R., Ruggero, C., Suzuki, N., & Watson, D. (2014). The Brief Experiential Avoidance Questionnaire: Development and initial validation. Psychological Assessment, 26(1), 35-45.

Name: Positive and Negative Affect Schedule
Subscales: Positive Affect, Negative Affect
Paper Reference: Watson, D., Clark, L. A., & Tellegen, A. (1988). Development and validation of brief measures of positive and negative affect: The PANAS scales. Journal of Personalityand Social Psychology, 54(6), 1063-1070.

Name: Penn State Worry Questionnaire
Measures: Worry Trait (especially in those with Anxiety)
Paper Reference: Meyer, T. J., Miller, M. L., Metsger, R. L., Borkovec, T. D. (1990). Development and validation of the penn state worry questionnaire. Behaviour Research and Therapy, 28, 487-495.

Name: Oldenburg Burnout Inventory
Subscales: Exhaustion, Disengagement
Paper Reference: Demerouti, E. (1999). Oldenburg Burnout Inventory [Database record]. APA PsycTests.

Name: Adult Separation Anxiety Questionnaire
Paper Reference: Manicavasagar, V., Silove, D., Wagner, R., & Drobny, J. (2003). A self-report questionnaire for measuring separation anxiety in adulthood. Comprehensive Psychiatry, 44(2), 146-153.

Name: Camouflaging Autistic Traits Questionnaire
Subscales: Compensation, Masking, Assimilation
Paper Reference: Hull, L., Mandy, W., Lai, M. C., Baron-Cohen, S., Allison, C., Smith, P., & Petrides, K. V. (2019). Development and validation of the Camouflaging Autistic Traits Questionnaire (CAT-Q). Journal of Autism and Developmental Disorders, 49(3), 819-833.

Name: Male Depression Risk Scale
Subscales: Internalising: Emotional suppression, Somatic symptoms; Externalising: Drug use, Alcohol use, Anger and aggression, Risk taking
Paper Reference: Rice, S. M., Fallon, B. J., Aucote, H. M., Möller-Leimkühler, A., Treeby, M. S., & Amminger, G. P. (2015). Longitudinal sex differences of externalising and internalising depressiom symptoms trajectories: Implications for assessment of depression in men from an online study. The International Journal of Social Psychiatry, 61(3), 236-240.
